intro: Spergula camarae, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, particularly in arid or semi-arid environments. Spergula camarae is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
